expected_behavior: Observe general rules of discipline, honesty, and punctuality.
Show respect for the rights of others.
Willful violation seriously disturbs the academic environment.
general_conduct_rules.id_card_requirement: Students must display their photo identification cards on campus at all times for safety and security.

academic_misconduct.description: Viewed as a grave breach of discipline with zero tolerance.
examples: Cheating at the examination by any method or means.
Helping other students to cheat in examinations.
Plagiarism (reproducing the work of others as one's own).
Fabrication or the falsification of any information with the intent to deceive.
Forgery, alteration, or misuse of university documents or records.
academic_misconduct.attendance_requirement: Students must attend a reasonable portion (not less than 80%) of the lectures, tutorials, and practical classes.

examples: Direct and indirect threat of violence.
Participation in any activity that may disrupt any function of the university.
Possession or use of alcoholic drinks and drugs.
Possession of sharp weapons and firearms.

probation_and_dismissal.undergraduate: CGPA below 2.25 leads to probation; CGPA below 1.0 after the first two or any subsequent semesters leads to automatic dismissal.
probation_and_dismissal.graduate: CGPA below 2.60 leads to probation; failure to raise it after two consecutive semesters leads to dismissal.

general_penalties: Cancellation of the examination and/or an assignment.
Expulsion for one or more semesters.
academic_status_and_disciplinary_action.disciplinary_procedure: Allegations are examined by the Discipline Committee, which recommends penalties to the authority. Penalties are reflected in the student's Academic Transcripts/documents.
